We are creating a jar file for all the Junit tests. Is it possible to 
execute the suite using TestRunner?

TestCaseClassLoader says that right now it is the limitation to load 
classes from a jar file? Is there a workaround ?

Since the structure is quite spread out. Eg:

com/xxxx/xxxxx1/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx1/xxxxx1.1/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx1/xxxxx1.2/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx1/xxxxx1.3/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx2/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx2/xxxxx2.1/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx2/xxxxx2.2/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx2/xxxxx2.3/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.1/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.2/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.3/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.3/xxxx3.3.1/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.3/xxxx3.3.2/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.3/xxxx3.3.3/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.3/xxxx3.3.4/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx3/xxxx3.4/AllTests
com/xxxx/xxxxx4/AllTests
........

Any immd. help is appreciated.

Regards,
Manish
